Dīghāvu's request to his father and the: Dīghāvu asks his father to request the Buddha to visit him
Jotika conveys the message to the Buddha
The Buddha consents and visits Dīghāvu
The Buddha advises Dīghāvu to train in experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, the Saṅgha, and ethical conduct leading to immersion
The four factors of stream-entry (a caus: Ethical conduct loved by the noble ones leading to immersion
The six things that play a part in reali: Meditating on the impermanence of all conditions
